method: Wash the rice and soak it for 30 minutes. Heat ghee or oil in a large pot, then fry the onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder to the pot. Stir well. Add the chicken and fry until it turns golden brown. Add the yogurt and stir well. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Add the soaked rice, salt, and 2 cups of water to the pot. Stir well. Cover the pot and cook on low heat for 30 minutes or until the rice is cooked.

Heat oil in a pan, then fry the onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder to the pan. Stir well Add the tomatoes and cook until they are soft and pulpy. Add fish pieces and stir gently. Add salt and 2 cups of water to the pan. Stir gently. Cover the pan and cook on medium heat for 10-15 minutes or until the fish is cooked

Wash the lentils and drain. Heat oil in a pan, then fry the onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder to the pan. Stir well. Add the lentils and stir well. Add salt and 2 cups of water to the pan. Stir gently. Cover the pan and cook on low heat for 30-40 minutes or until the lentils are soft and tender.

Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until they turn golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste to the pan and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the beef cubes to the pan and fry until they turn brown. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder to the pan and mix well. Add salt and 1/2 cup of water to the pan, cover it, and let it simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the beef is tender. Once done, remove from heat and serve hot with rice or flatbread.

Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until they turn golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste to the pan and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the chicken pieces to the pan and fry until they turn brown. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder to the pan and mix well. Add salt and 1/2 cup of water to the pan, cover it, and let it simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Once done, remove from heat and serve hot with rice or flatbread.

Wash the lentils and soak them in water for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until they turn golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste to the pan and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the lentils to the pan and fry for a minute or two. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, and 4 cups of water to the pan, and mix well. Cover the pan and let the lentils cook for 30-40 minutes, or until they become soft. Once done, remove from heat and serve hot with rice.

Grind the mustard seeds and green chilies into a paste. Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. Set aside. In the same pan, add the mustard paste, red chili powder, and salt

Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, and fry until golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add cumin, coriander, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. Add chicken pieces and cook for 10-15 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
ingredients: Fresh coriander leaves, finely chopped for garnishing

method: Heat oil in a pan and fry the prawns until pink. Remove from the pan and keep aside. In the same pan, add onion, ginger paste, and garlic paste and fry until the onion is translucent. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt and fry for 2-3 minutes. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. Add the fried prawns to the gravy and simmer for 5-10 minutes.

Cook the rice and set aside. Fry the potatoes until golden brown and set aside. Fry the onions until golden brown, then add ginger and garlic and cook for a minute. Add marinated meat and cook until tender. Add spices, yogurt, and salt. Layer the rice, meat, and potatoes in a pot and cook over low heat for 20-30 minutes.
ingredients: spices (cinnamon, cardamom, bay leaf, cumin, coriander)

method: Fry the onions until golden brown, then add ginger and garlic and cook for a minute. Add meat and cook until tender. Add spices, yogurt, and cream and cook for a few more minutes. Add salt to taste.

In a mixing bowl, mix rice flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead until a smooth dough is formed. In a separate pan, melt jaggery with 1/4 cup water and stir until it becomes a thick syrup. Add grated coconut to the jaggery syrup and mix well. Divide the rice dough into small balls. Flatten the balls and place a spoonful of the coconut-jaggery mixture in the center.Fold the edges of the dough to make a small pouch and seal it tightly.Steam the pithas for 15-20 minutes.Serve hot.

Mix boiled chickpeas, diced potato, chopped onion, chopped tomato, and chopped green chili in a bowl. Add tamarind pulp, chaat masala, roasted cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

Wash the rice thoroughly and soak in water for 30 minutes. Heat ghee and oil in a large pot. Add sliced onions and fry until they turn golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste and fry for 2 minute. Baki tuku chat gpt kheye felseðŸ™‚

Heat ghee and oil in a pan. Add bay leaf, green cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks, and cloves. Fry for a minute. Add chicken pieces and fry for 5-7 minutes until it turns golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, nutmeg powder, mace powder, green cardamom powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for 2 minutes. Add yogurt and fry for another 5-7 minutes until the chicken is cooked. Add 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

Heat ghee and oil in a pan. Add bay leaf, green cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks, and cloves. Fry for a minute. Add mutton pieces and fry for 5-7 minutes until it turns golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, nutmeg powder, mace powder, green cardamom powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for 2 minutes. Add yogurt and fry for another 5-7 minutes until the mutton is cooked. Add 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil. Simmer for 30-40 minutes until the mutton is tender. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until they turn golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste to the pan and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the chicken pieces to the pan and fry until they turn brown. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder to the pan and mix well. Add salt and 1/2 cup of water to the pan, cover it, and let it simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Once done, remove from heat and serve hot with rice or flatbread.

Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until they turn golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste to the pan and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the beef cubes to the pan and fry until they turn brown. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder to the pan and mix well. Add salt and 1/2 cup of water to the pan, cover it, and let it simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the beef is tender. Once done, remove from heat and serve hot with rice or flatbread.
